results.title: The New morality
results.creator_credit: Mel Stuart, Richard Schickel and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Life goes to the movies”.
Hosted by Henry Fonda, Shirley MacLaine and Liza Minnelli. Takes a look at the life and career of Marilyn Monroe as well as the movies of the sixties. Their language, sexuality and violence portraying a new morality unthinkable a deecade earlier. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mel Stuart, Richard Schickel and Time-Life Films

results.title: The Fifties
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Life goes to the movies”.
Examines the impact of television and the courts’ decisions to separate film exhibition from production and distribution in Hollywood’s film industry during the period up to the seventies. Shows a series of film clips exemplifying the 1950’s preoccupation with romantic love themes. Suitable for Upper Secondary School Students.

results.title: The Post-war era
results.creator_credit: Mel Stuart, Jack Haley, Malcolm Leo, Richard Schickel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Life goes to the movies”.
Hollywood turned to more mature themes in the late 1940s and early 1950s. Looks at “Film Noir” such as “Snake Pit” and “Lost Weekend”. Following McCarthyism hundreds of professionals were blacklisted. Another change of approach brought on a spate of monster films. Hosted by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The War years
results.creator_credit: Mel Stuart, Richard Schickel and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Life goes to the movies”.
Discusses Hollywood’s studio magnates and some of the 1939 spectacular films. Shows the industry’s was effort contribution via propaganda films, the creation of symbolic heroes and stars’ entertainment of the troops. Hosted by Henry Fonda and Shirley MacLaine.

results.title: Greece: playground of the gods
results.creator_credit: Chip Duncan, Peter May, Crouse Entertainment and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Greece is a land rich in natural beauty, history and tradition; its sun-drenched islands surrounded by sparkling water. Travelling through the countryside exposes the tourist to a wealth of history and and myth; whether it be at the Acropolis, the home of the Gods in Athens or in Crete where the ruins of Knossos and the legendary palace of King Midas can be found. Visit the Plaka where the locals sip Greek coffee and discuss politics and life, see the magnificent windmills of Mykonos and admire some of the finest ancient classical architecture ever constructed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chip Duncan, Peter May, Crouse Entertainment and International Video Network

results.title: Paris
results.creator_credit: Valerie Archer, International Video Network and Visa Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
A tourist’s guide to the main historical sites, hotels, shopping, nightlife and food of one of the world’s most loved cities - Paris. Includes a segment on the Palace of Versailles.

results.title: Poland: a proud heritage
results.creator_credit: Andrew K Slodkowski, Chris Valentini and Hughes Leisure Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit Poland, the land of lakes, palaces, forests, cathedrals, sandy beaches and heroes and legends of the past. Visit the capital of Warsaw with its newly restored historical buildings. In Castle Square see the Royal Castle and Sigmund’s Column, the symbol of the city. Travel to Cracow’s Wawel Hill, the ancient seat of Polish kings and hear Polish folklore in the Tatras mountains. Experience the serenity of Bialowieza, Europe’s last virgin woodland. Pause in reflection at the Auschwitz Memorial, travel down the Dunajec River and visit the monastery of Jasna Gora, to see the Black Madonna.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew K Slodkowski, Chris Valentini and Hughes Leisure Group

results.title: Alaska: the Alaska experience
results.creator_credit: Michael Heumann, Suzie Heumann and Sonoma Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit vast Alaska and its Northern lights, active volcanos, mountains, lakes and rivers. Alaska is the country of the unexpected. People can sometimes be found fishing at midnight and sunset can be at noon. Take a cruise through the inside passage, home of whales, seals and thousands of birds. Visit Ketchika where the people have largely kept to their traditional ways, and Sitka and its Russian architecture. At Juneau, visit the Red Dog Saloon and at Anchorage, Alaska’s largest city, watch a canoe race and ride a hot air balloon. Meet the locals of Alaska, the Eskimos, Indians and Aleuts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Heumann, Suzie Heumann and Sonoma Video

results.title: Finland: fresh and original
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit unspoilt and unhurried Finland at the crossroads between East and West. Learn about the history of Finland and the Swedish influence on this country. Visit the Baltic port of Helsinki, Jyuaskyla and Finland’s second largest city at Tampere with it famous Lutheran cathedral. Step back in time in Turka with its handicraft museum and visit the Sibelius Museum. Travel north to the unspoilt wilderness of Lapland where the Lapps still tend herds of reindeer. Experience a sauna Finnish style.
